title: ATen rebuild process consistently fails to pick up new symbols
body_html:
Steps to reproduce:

  1. Check out 7ff9e0e
  2. Do a clean build
  3. Fast forward one commit to d5a7e30 (which adds a new THNN implementation)
  4. Do an incremental build with python setup.py build develop
  5. Do python -c "import torch"

Expected result: It works
Actual result: It fails with:

(/home/ezyang/local/onnx-pytorch/env) [ezyang@devgpu005.ash6 ~/local/benchmark] python -c "import torch"
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<string>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/data/users/ezyang/onnx-pytorch/pytorch/torch/__init__.py", line 53, in <module>
    from torch._C import *
ImportError: /data/users/ezyang/onnx-pytorch/pytorch/torch/lib/libATen.so.1: undefined symbol: THNN_CudaDoubleVolumetricAdaptiveMaxPooling_updateGradInput

Work around is to rm -rf torch/lib/build but I would much rather we fix our build system so I don't have to do this.

CC @zdevito @killeent

body:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Check out 7ff9e0eb6c61855ba9721b3fdfa28c20c527cf4b
2. Do a clean build
3. Fast forward one commit to d5a7e304fa858136eeffa1ebe35e22ed886bf256 (which adds a new THNN implementation)
4. Do an incremental build with `python setup.py build develop`
5. Do `python -c "import torch"`

Expected result: It works
Actual result: It fails with:

```
(/home/ezyang/local/onnx-pytorch/env) [ezyang@devgpu005.ash6 ~/local/benchmark] python -c "import torch"
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<string>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/data/users/ezyang/onnx-pytorch/pytorch/torch/__init__.py", line 53, in <module>
    from torch._C import *
ImportError: /data/users/ezyang/onnx-pytorch/pytorch/torch/lib/libATen.so.1: undefined symbol: THNN_CudaDoubleVolumetricAdaptiveMaxPooling_updateGradInput
```

Work around is to `rm -rf torch/lib/build` but I would much rather we fix our build system so I don't have to do this.

CC @zdevito @killeent
